1.text: A false balance is an abomination to Yahweh, but accurate weights are his delight.

2.text: When pride comes, then comes shame, but with humility comes wisdom.

3.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them, but the perverseness of the treacherous shall destroy them.

4.text: Riches don’t profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death.

5.text: The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way, but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

6.text: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, but the unfaithful will be trapped by evil desires.

7.text: When a wicked man dies, hope perishes, and expectation of power comes to nothing.

8.text: A righteous person is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked takes his place.

9.text: With his mouth the godless man destroys his neighbor, but the righteous will be delivered through knowledge.

10.text: When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices. When the wicked perish, there is shouting.

11.text: By the blessing of the upright, the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

12.text: One who despises his neighbor is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding holds his peace.

13.text: One who brings gossip betrays a confidence, but one who is of a trustworthy spirit is one who keeps a secret.

14.text: Where there is no wise guidance, the nation falls, but in the multitude of counselors there is victory.

15.text: He who is collateral for a stranger will suffer for it, but he who refuses pledges of collateral is secure.

16.text: A gracious woman obtains honor, but violent men obtain riches.

17.text: The merciful man does good to his own soul, but he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.

18.text: Wicked people earn deceitful wages, but one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.

19.text: He who is truly righteous gets life. He who pursues evil gets death.

20.text: Those who are perverse in heart are an abomination to Yahweh, but those whose ways are blameless are his delight.

21.text: Most certainly, the evil man will not be unpunished, but the seed of the righteous will be delivered.

22.text: Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout, is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.

23.text: The desire of the righteous is only good. The expectation of the wicked is wrath.

24.text: There is one who scatters, and increases yet more. There is one who withholds more than is appropriate, but gains poverty.

25.text: The liberal soul shall be made fat. He who waters shall be watered also himself.

26.text: People curse someone who withholds grain, but blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.

27.text: He who diligently seeks good seeks favor, but he who searches after evil, it shall come to him.

28.text: He who trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous shall flourish as the green leaf.

29.text: He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind. The foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.

30.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life. He who is wise wins souls.

31.text: Behold, the righteous shall be repaid in the earth; how much more the wicked and the sinner!
